alert.note: Alert for Greenwood (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 6:26PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following county, Greenwood. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Nuisance to Minor flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including farmland, greenways,low-water crossings, underpasses, urbanized areas, and low-lying roadways and parking lots. High flows over low-water crossings and low-lying roadways are possible and water may approach low-lying structures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 619 PM EDT, Numerous thunderstorms are developing over Greenwood County and are quickly producing significant rainfall. Up to 2 inches of rain has fallen over the past 60-90 minutes. Minor flooding is imminent. If this heavy rain persists, a Flash Flood Warning may be issued. Caution is advised near any stream or other vulnerable area, including flood-prone areas in the city of Greenwood. If you live near a stream or creek be prepared to seek higher ground when the water begins to rise. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Greenwood, Ware Shoals, Ninety Six, Cokesbury, Hodges, Troy, Ninety Six Historic Site, Lake Greenwood, Greenwood State Park, Shoals Junction, Promised Land, Bradley, Coronaca, Epworth, Callison, Kirksey and Dyson.
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
